newsitem.title: GERMANY: Poland floods cost around $3 billion - Bonn envoy.
newsitem.headline: Poland floods cost around $3 billion - Bonn envoy.

text.p: The worst flooding in centuries last month in Poland caused damage estimated at between five and six billion marks ($2.5 to 3.3 billion), Warsaw's ambassador to Germany Andrzej Byrt said on Thursday.
Byrt said the costs of the floods that killed 54 people and swamped huge areas of farmland could be even higher, but the final total would only be known in about three months.
The most recent tentative estimates had put the cost of the flooding at four to five billion zlotys ($1 billion to $1.4 billion).
Byrt thanked Germany for its quick help and said donations from companies and individuals had reached 15 million marks (about $8 million).
"We were positively surprised by the volume of help from our partners -- especially Germany," Byrt told journalists in Bonn.
Byrt said 145 of the 2,600 towns and villages hit by last month's high waters were still under water, 28 of them completely submerged.
